description: The idea to create this podcast came to us during the quarantine of summer 2020 whenever the world seemed to be on pause. Topics ranging from orchestral repertoire, conducting, music education, etc. would come up in hour long Facetime calls. One day, we decided to share our discussions with the world, and Relative Pitch was born. We feel that the purpose of our podcast is to showcase the talent, leadership, and passion that we see within our field of music, and to help pave the way for much needed change in our community that will make it a more diverse, enriching, and equitable atmosphere for anyone who wants to be a part of it.

title: MASCOM PODCAST: TREĆI SVET
description:
TREĆI SVET

Podcast, trajanje preko 60 minuta.

Emisija rodonačelnika gonzo novinarstva i pisanja u Srbiji.

Dule Nedeljković preferira bona fide stil pisanja i identičnog govora. Insistira da naziva stvari pravim imenom a takva iskrenost se očekuje i od gostiju u podkastu. U trenutku kada se društvo brendiralo na njihove i naše, postoji Treći svet, koji ne trpi ograničenja i ne govori „mi“ umesto „ja“. Svako kome je govornica nedostupna ili ima iskrenu želju da se ispovedi, dobro došao je.

Razgovori će biti usmereni ka budućnosti, svaki gost će biti instruisan pred snimanje. Svi će dobiti unapred temu razgovora i neće se tolerisati nespremnost za spremnost u učestvovanju. Gonzo novinarstvo je novinarski stil koji se piše subjektivno, često uključujući samog izvještača kao deo priče putem naracije u prvom licu. Gonzo novinarstvo ima tendenciju da favorizuje stil na račun tačnosti i često koristi lična iskustva i emocije kako bi se prikazao kontekst teme ili događaja koji je pokriven. Karakteriše ga upotreba citata, sarkazma, humora, preterivanja i psovki. Ocem gonzo novinarstva smatra se Hanter S, Tomson, američki novinar i pisac. Ako vas još nešto zanima, guglajte!

title: Chatting with Creators
description:
Amid the COVID-19 pandemic, I sought out a way to create content that, like Coffee With Composers allows people to connect to musicians on a personal level. During this time, I thought we needed it more than usual. When members of the Glenn Korff School of Music reached out to me about creating videos to help keep our community connected, I thought this would be a perfect idea. Going beyond the Flyover New Music Series, in Chatting With Creators, I connect with various creatives from the music industry to talk to them about how they’re dealing with the pandemic, their advice for students, and most importantly, how we all stay connected even when we’re apart. 

I thought this would be a one-and-done series, but I've had so many requests to continue! I love making the series, so here's season two! For season one information, check out sapphiretoth.com

title: Titanic Reaction with Tony Mengis
description:
"I was born and raised in Portland, Oregon, one of the best underground music scenes in the world. I got into the underground metal scene in the early eighties and found punk a few years later. Sometimes for better, sometimes for worse, punk has been one of the biggest influences of my life ever since. I've been in a few bands and toured every chance I got. I've been a booker at a few clubs and even owned a couple. With my background, I was excited to see my niece and nephew get into punk. I was also a little worried, but they are smarter than me so have avoided making the same mistakes. It made me wonder what, after almost 50 years, still attracts people to the subculture. Also, what keeps people involved into their 30’s, 40’s, 50’s and beyond. Charlie Harper is in his 70’s and has been touring since 1976. I’ll be talking to bands from around the world, and also people who keep punk alive behind the scenes. I’ll be asking them what attracted them to punk in the first place and what keeps them around for decades. I’m looking forward to the conversations, because sometimes I can't even answer it for myself. Beware, there will be a lot of talk about Portland. I moved to Amsterdam a few years ago and miss Portland every day, so I love to hear stories about it. Also, as much as I hate some things about it, it is one of the best cities on earth. Also beware, these are real stories- well, most of them are. They will contain tales of alcohol, drugs, sex and extreme violence and language that Mary Whitehouse would not approve of. Take caution and thank you listening, I appreciate each and every one of you."
Written and Hosted by Tony Mengis Produced & Edited by Chelsea Clyde Mixed and Mastered by Joe Mengis

description:
The Cobblestone Podcast is a series of conversations with prominent figures from the rich musical community, based in the Cobblestone pub at the top of Smithfield square, Dublin.

Created by Tom Mulligan in 1988, the Cobblestone has played host to Traditional music sessions daily, for the last 30 years. Be it a session up the front or a concert in the Back Room venue, there is an inevitability of bumping into top-class musicians with a passion for their art. the Cobblestone has no TVs or pool tables and people are encouraged to sit back with a pint, have a conversation, or listen to some great music. 

Join hosts, Ispini na hEireann, who interview a plethora of Musicians and Characters that have made their way through the doors of the cobblestone at one time or another. We hope you enjoy this podcast and it brings you just a small bit closer to the comfort Cobblestone through the medium of conversation.

With thanks to Tom Mulligan for giving us this opportunity and Neillidh Mulligan for allowing us the use of his tune, Barr Na Cuille, as our theme. Thanks To Stephen McCann For his tireless work on sound.

find us @ http://cobblestonepub.ie/
                 Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/ispini_na_heireann/
get in touch @ sausagesofireland@gmail.com

Hosts: Adam Holohan & Tomas Mulligan (Ispini Na hErieann)
Sound: Stephen McCann

title: Far Off Sounds Podcast
description:
Far Off Sounds is a webseries of documentaries about the infinite story of music on Earth. From harsh industrial noise performed for fish in an aquarium, to a heavy metal cruise ship in the Caribbean, Far Off Sounds has been filming the ways that humans use and engage with music for a decade. 

The Far Off Sounds Podcast expands on this project. The show's creators, Jacob Hurwitz-Goodman and Nick George, interview ethnomusicologists, experimental musical meme pedagogues, musicians, label artists, journalists and others in long-form conversations about music, as well as providing a behind-the-scene glimpse at the doc series' production.

title: The Sweaty Palms Podcast
description: Hi everyone, I'm Zoë, and welcome to the Sweaty Palms Podcast. Sweaty Palms is a music industry podcast I started in my final semester of college. I was studying music business at the time and wanted to work in the industry after graduating, but wasn't exactly sure what I wanted to do. So, this podcast became a resource for me that morphed into a passion project. You might be wondering why I named the podcast Sweaty Palms. Well, it's because when I get nervous, my hands sweat, and I tend to get nervous in social settings, like talking to people. Sometimes it's endearing, or at least that's what I tell myself. Through this process, I’ve fallen in love with interviewing people, which I guess was a happy accident. If you're interested in listening each week, you'll hear from people who work in this industry, whether it’s musicians, tour managers, talent buyers, venue owners, songwriters, and more. I'm happy to have you here, and thanks for listening. If you want to keep up with me and hear more updates follow me on Instagram @sweatypalmspodcast.

title: 52 The Podcast
description:
"52 – The Podcast" with Kristian Bush and Cindy Watts celebrates the stories behind Bush's new and award-winning songs. Original episodes will be released for free every week for 52 weeks. 

Bush, half of the Grammy-winning duo Sugarland, half of the critically acclaimed Americana folk-rock duo Billy Pilgrim and a founding member of rock group Dark Water, is releasing 52 songs over the next year in honor of his 52nd birthday on March 14, 2022.  

The album project, also called "52," will come out in four volumes over the next 12-to-18 months. 

Each episode of "52 – The Podcast" will explore the relationship between one of the popular songs from Bush's back catalog and one of the new songs from "52." Bush and Watts give insight into the songwriting process, the singer/songwriter's day-to-day life, and the musical journey that took him from his hometown of Sevierville, Tenn., to Atlanta, Nashville, and around the world as part of his various bands. 

Fun fact: Bush and Watts, a CMA Award-winning country music journalist, are from the same hometown. They share poignant moments, hilarity and plenty of dad jokes as they wind their way through their middle-age in the music business experience and Bush's life of songs.

title: The Brass Ceiling
description:
Hi everyone! I’m Yael and welcome to The Brass Ceiling.

I am a trumpet player, but also a musician, and most importantly, a storyteller. I also happen to be a girl, and despite it being 2022, only 3% of trumpet players are female. Consequently, I have always had to navigate a male-dominated environment riddled with gender, age, and power dynamics… in other words I’ve dealt with a lot of crap and I’m sick of it!

The title of this podcast, The Brass Ceiling, is really just a play on the phrase "the glass ceiling"; this pun on the famous saying feels relevant as I want to bring to light the gendered struggle that female brass players experience which is preventing them from thriving in this niche, just as on a more macro level, women and most non-straight-cis-white-men have to navigate countless systems that were not built with them in mind.

I want to use this space to talk about our stories and our musical journeys, but I also want to use this platform to crowdsource and workshop ideas to make the arts more equitable. The goal is to find that sweet spot that is fun and nostalgic, but also rigorous and forward-facing. I’m hoping that by sharing our experiences, by engaging in dialogue about the systems that need changing, and by delving into music in a way that is accessible as well as palatable,  that we will in fact be shattering the Brass Ceiling, together.

title: Latin American & Iberian Song
description:
Hosted by soprano and musicologist Patricia Caicedo, the 𝗟𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗻 𝗔𝗺𝗲𝗿𝗶𝗰𝗮𝗻 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗜𝗯𝗲𝗿𝗶𝗮𝗻 𝗔𝗿𝘁 𝗦𝗼𝗻𝗴 𝗣𝗼𝗱𝗰𝗮𝘀𝘁 is a program to discover composers, poets, songs, and everything about the world of Latin American and Spanish songs. 𝗠𝘂𝗹𝘁𝗶𝗹𝗶𝗻𝗴𝘂𝗮𝗹 𝗣𝗿𝗼𝗴𝗿𝗮𝗺 𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗵 𝗘𝗽𝗶𝘀𝗼𝗱𝗲𝘀 𝗶𝗻 𝗘𝗻𝗴𝗹𝗶𝘀𝗵, 𝗦𝗽𝗮𝗻𝗶𝘀𝗵, 𝗣𝗼𝗿𝘁𝘂𝗴𝘂𝗲𝘀𝗲, 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗖𝗮𝘁𝗮𝗹𝗮𝗻.

title: Jazz Backstory
description:
The podcast series, Jazz Backstory, is based on the holdings of the Fillius Jazz Archive (https://www.hamilton.edu/campuslife/arts-at-hamilton/jazzarchive) located at Hamilton College (https://www.hamilton.edu/), in Clinton, New York. Established in 1995, and dedicated in 2013 in honor of Milton F. Fillius, Jr. ’44 and Nelma “Nikki” Nenneau Fillius, the Fillius Jazz Archive holds a collection of over 440 videotaped interviews with jazz musicians, arrangers, writers and producers. The wide-ranging collection includes interviews with sidemen, soloists and band leaders who have performed from the 1920s through the present. 

Jazz Backstory podcast episodes will feature interview excerpts focused on topics inherent to the creative life. Artists, both famous and unsung, relate these tales in their own jazz inflected vocabulary. Original music and commentary from the host help set the tone, both educational and swinging.

Monk Rowe (https://www.monkrowe.com/), creator of the podcast series, Jazz Backstory, and the Joe Williams Director of the Fillius Jazz Archive, conducted the majority of  the interviews and has presented programs about the resource at conferences for the Jazz Education Network, the Music Library Association, and the International Society of Music Educators. Monk co-authored with Romy Britell  the book Jazz Tales From Jazz Legends on Hamilton’s Couper Press and created the edX online course, “Jazz: The Music, The Stories, The Players” in collaboration with members of the Library and Instructional Technology Services at Hamilton College. He is an active performer on saxophone and piano and has composed numerous works for both jazz and classical ensembles.

title: Magnetic Meaning
description:
Magnetic Meaning is a podcast about words and music. 
Because too often, people working or pursuing careers in the music industry get so caught up in the excitement, clout, and daily grind of it all that forget this whole industry is just about communication. Magnetic Meaning unpacks this notion and dissects the words and ideas that connect the music and resonate with those who work with it. 
Each episode will feature different guests from across the music industry, each doing amazing things in their own right. These guests will each bring a word to the table that has impacted their life or career in one way or another. From there, we will tackle that word from every conceivable angle in hopes to add a bit more context to what the music industry actually is. 

Episodes are published on a bi-weekly basis, first thing every other Thursday.

title: Two Weeks From Tuesday
description:
Two Weeks from Tuesday co-creators, Aliya Bloom and Erynn Wakefield have always connected through music. Most of their friendship has been long distance and paired with their busy lives, it seemed to be a recipe for disaster. But, over the years, they have shared music as a way to reach out, keep in touch, and keep tabs on each other. Whether it was through collaborative playlists, seasonal playlists, or even a quick song here and there; Two Weeks From Tuesday is unique in its approach, serving as a podcast as well as a platform for new artists. And when they can’t be live and talking to you, they’re still with you through corresponding playlists made for their listeners for every episode. 

This podcast truly wraps music and life into one entity and demonstrates how essential music is to the human experience. Most of all, Two Weeks From Tuesday aims to be honest. Co-creators, Aliya Bloom and Erynn Wakefield, truly want to reach out to their listeners with a helping hand and say, “we understand.”

title: Cloud Machine
description:
Cloud Machine is a weekly music business video podcast hosted by Mat Landry and industry insiders. In weekly episodes, he and his guests have informative discussions about music, its modern realities, and common practices that are so often kept behind closed doors. They discuss current themes that affect today's music landscape and how to navigate through them as a fan, musician, or business professional.

This podcast aims to educate viewers and listeners on what they want and need to know about the music industry, including label/organizational structure & negotiation, distribution & modern streaming practices, and the live performance sector. Cloud Machine does so by interviewing knowledgeable music business professionals, by pulling down your favourite artists' backstage curtain, and by staying up to date on innovative topics.

Find our video podcasts on the Eights Creative Youtube channel!

description:
Welcome to Building Bridges, a Eurovision Song Contest podcast for the rest of us. We are Sebi, Jan and Dave and we are not the typical Eurovision fans to run a podcast. Two of us aren't native English speakers and the other is from a country that doesn't even participate in Eurovision! This international podcast is for all the outcasts in this world and for everyone who enjoys talking and learning about the world's biggest and best music competition!

title: Il Cazz8- Elia Frasco
description:
Elia, un conduttore imprevedibile, esilarante e molto amato dal pubblico.

I tormentoni e le sue rubriche rendono Il Cazz8, in onda da Lunedì a Venerdì, dalle 09:00 alle 12:00, il morning show da non perdere.
Non annoia, e i fuori programma sono alla base di quella dose di adrenalina e buon umore che non può mancare nelle nostre giornate.
Il Cazz8 è il programma più longevo su Rsc-Radio Studio Centrale e se provassimo a chiedere, proprio ad Elia, qual è la ricetta del successo, per uno che di peli sulla lingua ne ha ben pochi, risponderebbe che in 15 anni di radio, proprio lui è diventato più maturo, grazie alla spontaneità che è necessaria per affrontare ogni giorno la diretta.

Do you support local music? Then get your azz over to our page The Zoo - Rock Rage Radio on Facebook and Instagram. Our Radio show debuted on Saturday November 19th. Join us every Saturday morning from 9am to 11am Central Time On Rock Rage Radio. Listen online or download the app.

If you’re a local original band in the Houston area, send us your music and information. We need more local music to feature on our show. Get your band on our playlist. thezoorrr@gmail.com

title: A Murder of Musicians
description:
A MURDER OF MUSICIANS

A.M.O.M. Podcast

This podcast aims to showcase and promote the work of up- and-coming musicians and artists from diverse musical genres all around the globe.

Join host Fx2, each week as he explores various platforms on social media along with music distribution sites to discover amazingly talented players involved in the game of independent publishing. Every conversation reveals the simple ways each artist used to grow followers organically without monetary backing from a record label.

During the last 2 and a half decades, Fx2 has seen what was previously considered "indie," slowly morph into semi-mainstream practices of marketing, promotion and media/press. He also has witnessed the reverse, noting that grass rooted campaigns once considered taboo for signed musicians to lose the attached stigma as more superstar talent utilized methods of what can only be called "Organic-Ish."

The podcast gives you an opportunity to hear how different musicians navigate their specific path as an independent artist. As social media platforms compete for ways to dominate one another, musicians are seeing the immense benefits of cooperation and collaboration instead.

title: The Piano Pod
description:
...where tradition meets innovation, and together, we bring PIANO into the 21st Century.

Hey, 🎹 enthusiasts out there! My name is Yukimi, a classical pianist and educator from NYC and executive producer of The Piano Pod. The Piano Pod🎙 is a one-of-a-kind podcast that delves deep into the fascinating world of classical music, with a specific focus on the 🎹 piano. In a biweekly format, the show explores intriguing discussions with guests breaking exciting new ground in the classical music industry. The Piano Pod aims to nurture a thriving community that embraces innovative approaches to ensure classical music's relevance and vitality in today's dynamic landscape.

"How can I present the beautiful tradition of classical music to the 21st-century audience in a fun, contemporary, and engaging way?"

When I started building a piano studio in the trendy neighborhood of Downtown Manhattan in 2007 while in the NYU graduate program in piano studies, I began to ponder this question. I realized the stark difference in expectations toward classical music and music education between music professionals and the general public. Then, one of the NYU music department's professors suggested I start a podcast: the platform would allow classical musicians to address this disparity and spark conversations about audience engagement.

Finally, fast forward to 10+ years later, The Piano Pod was born in the summer of 2020. Since then, I have had the privilege of interviewing A-listers in the classical music industry: international concert pianists, composers, arrangers, digital streamers/influencers, music educators, entrepreneurs, neurodiverse specialists, and performance psychologists.

Through fascinating conversations, we have explored how classical music should continue to evolve to remain relevant to our lifestyle, society, and culture. Over the past three seasons, The Piano Pod has achieved remarkable success by reaching faithful listeners on audio platforms and viewers via YouTube.

As the show is celebrating the past season's achievements and gearing toward the new season in the fall, my mission as the Executive Producer is crystal clear: to provide a platform for classical musicians and educators to reflect and discuss ways to keep our industry robust and meaningful in this ever-changing world and move it forward in the post-pandemic era.

🔗Follow TPP on social media accounts to get the latest news about 🎹.

Thanks for listening♥️🎹

title: Khu.éex’
description:
This is a deep listening journey into the story of Khu.éex’ as told by the band’s co-founder Preston Singletary and guitarist Captain Raab. The band was formed in 2013 after a chance meeting with Bernie Worrell, keyboardist and co-founding member of Parliament-Funkadelic. Khu.éex’ is an Indigenous band that explores Jazz and Funk/Rock with an improvisational style. The fusion of these styles with spoken word in English, Tlingit, Haida and Y’upic languages is unique. Together with Skerik and Stanton Moore, Gene Tagaban and Clarissa Rizal, they recorded under the direction of Randall Dunn and created four prolific albums; The Wilderness Within, They Forgot They Survived, H​é​en, and WOOch. This five episode podcast series will tell the story of how they met, and dive deep into the musical compositions on each record.

Khu.éex’ is currently working on new music! Learn more about how you can support the band and get involved at https://igg.me/at/khueexmusic/x#/

“ Music With A Twist," the series where we delve deep into the world of music business professionals and creatives. We have an incredible lineup of guests who will share their invaluable experiences and insights from the music industry. Remember, the world of music is waiting for you with a twist!

description: Welcome to "Dan and The Fork: From TL3's Bedroom"! Join Dan and Tom in TL3's intimate bedroom conversations as they dive into two of their biggest passions: music and sports. In each episode, Dan and Tom, two self-proclaimed enthusiasts, explore the latest happenings in the world of music and sports. From dissecting the greatest albums and singles to discussing the thrilling victories and heart-wrenching defeats of their favorite teams, this dynamic duo leaves no stone unturned. Get ready for thought-provoking discussions, lively debates, and entertaining banter as Dan and Tom share their unique perspectives and insights. Whether you're a die-hard music aficionado or a sports fanatic, this podcast promises to provide a refreshing take on both subjects. Tune in to "Dan and The Fork: From TL3's Bedroom" for engaging conversations, hilarious anecdotes, and a peek into the lives of two passionate individuals who know how to blend their love for music and sports seamlessly. title: SEE THE UNSEEN Podcast w/Melissa Georgeoff
description:
Thanks for watching my podcast where I create a little visibility for people who deserve the whole spotlight.

I've spent over 30 years of my career advocating for people with disabilities, so they have access to the proper equipment & service.

I'm taking my passion and extending it by sharing stories to bring an awareness of the challenges & successes of people with disabilities, women in business, and singer/songwriters (the creative minds & the work that goes on behind the songs), etc.

I want to share my own personal journey to encourage others that no matter your circumstance, no matter your history, you can also create a life fueled by passion & purpose.

I'll also be sharing my faith in the hopes of inspiring others to believe in what we can't see.

title: Music2PSYCHOLOGY, Είρκη Μπαζάκα, CRYSTALEX | DARK PODCASTS
description:
Η Είρκη Μπαζάκα είναι μια διάσημη στιχουργός με έντονο σκοτεινό ύφος, που έχει κερδίσει ευρεία αναγνώριση για τους ποιητικούς στίχους της. Με τη μοναδική της προσέγγιση και την ενδιαφέρουσα αισθητική, έχει καταφέρει να καθηλώσει το ακροατήριο της.

Εντούτοις, η δημιουργικότητά της δεν περιορίζεται μόνο στους στίχους. Η Είρκη εξερευνά νέα μονοπάτια ψυχαγωγίας και παρουσιάζει τον κόσμο της μέσα από ένα σκοτεινό podcast. Το dark podcast της εστιάζει στη μουσική και εξερευνά τον κόσμο των μυστηρίων μέσα από μια συναρπαστική σύνθεση των δύο στοιχείων. Με αναλύσεις, ιστορίες και ανεξερεύνητα μυστικά, καταφέρνει να προσφέρει μια μοναδική και σκοτεινή εμπειρία ψυχαγωγίας στο ακροατήριο της.

Μέσα από το podcast της, η Είρκη Μπαζάκα δημιουργεί μια ατμόσφαιρα που συνδυάζει το μυστήριο και την απόκοσμη αισθητική, καθιστώντας το ένα από τα πιο αγαπημένα και εθιστικά podcasts για τους λάτρεις της μουσικής και των μυστηρίων.

title: CRYSTALEX
description:
Ο CRYSTALEX είναι ένας ιδιαίτερος τραγουδοποιός που έχει εισαγάγει στην Ελλάδα το Shock Rock, με ελληνικό στίχο και μια εντυπωσιακή εμφάνιση. Το κόκκινο μάτι του υποδηλώνει το κακό μας, ενώ το γαλάζιο μάτι του το αγγελικό μας πλευρό. Η εμφάνισή του είναι gothic και η μουσική του ανήκει στο εναλλακτικό rock με έντονα στοιχεία μετάλλων όπως Gothic Metal, Shock Pop, Industrial rock, Post-metal, Pop rock, και Doom Metal Post -metal

Το κανάλι που δημιούργησε είναι ένας χώρος όπου ανεβάζει διάφορα "potcasts," πιθανότατα εκπομπές ή podcasts, προσφέροντας στο κοινό του μοναδικό περιεχόμενο, συζητήσεις και μουσική. Μέσα από το κανάλι αυτό, μπορεί να μοιραστεί την τέχνη και τις ιδέες του με τους θαυμαστές του και να συνδέσει τη μουσική του με ένα ευρύτερο κοινό.

  • CRYSTALEX is a unique songwriter who introduced Shock Rock to Greece, with Greek lyrics and a striking appearance. He has a red eye symbolizing our darker side and a blue eye representing our angelic aspect. His gothic-inspired look complements his music, which falls under the genre of Alternative Rock with elements of Gothic Metal, Shock Pop, Industrial Rock, Post-Metal, Pop Rock, and Doom Metal.

    He created this channel to share various "potcasts," likely referring to shows or podcasts, offering his audience exclusive content, discussions, and music. Through this channel, he can share his art and ideas with his fans and connect his music to a broader audience.

title: Ross Goes North: Musicians of Scotland
description:
Welcome to "Ross Goes North: Musicians of Scotland", a captivating and insightful podcast, a mini 'podcast EP' if you will, that takes you on a melodic journey through the diverse musical landscape of today's Scotland. Join us as we sit down with four extraordinary musicians from various genres, some habituated, some green, all hailing from the picturesque highlands.

In each episode, our host, Ross Ferguson, a passionate music enthusiast with Scottish roots himself, will engage in intimate and insightful conversations with these talented artists. Discover their unique stories, inspirations, and the essence of their Scottish musical roots that resonate through their captivating live performances.

title: Entrevista a los hijos del compositor Tomás Méndez
description:
Entrevista a los hijos del compositor Tomás Méndez autor y compositor de Cucurrucucú paloma, Paloma negra, Leña de pirúl y otros éxitos mas.

En la casa de El Indio Fernández coincidió con Lola Beltrán y se convirtió en su compositor de cabecera. Con ella, en 1952 alcanzaron el éxito La luna dijo que no, Que me toquen las golondrinas, Tres días, Desafío, Gorrioncillo pecho amarillo, Huapango torero y la internacional Cucurrucucú paloma.

Otras obras de su autoría son Las rejas no matan, Los amigos del mayor, La muerte, A los cuatro vientos, Cuando canta la paloma, Puñalada trapera, El tren sin pasajeros, La muerte de un gallero, Paloma déjame ir, Golondrina presumida, Paloma negra, Suspenso infernal, El ramalazo, Bala perdida, El globero, No le temo a la muerte, Leña de pirul y Laguna de pesares, por mencionar algunas que fueron encumbradas por artistas como Pedro Infante, Javier Solís, Amalia Mendoza La tariácuri, Lucha Villa y María Dolores Pradera.

title: Actor Essentials: Headshots & Self-Tapes That Shine
description:
Want to light up casting director's inboxes and land more roles? Your headshot and self-tape are the most vital tools in your actor's toolkit. Join hosts Angelica Novak and special guest Thomas Philipp, a talent agent from Dry Blue Agency London, as they dive deep on nailing these essentials for acting success.

Discover what makes for a winning, work-getting headshot—from finding the ideal photographer to styling, posing, and avoiding common mistakes. Thomas shares insider tips on headshots that pop, like pursuing naturalism, matching your vibe to your brand, and keeping the focus on your eyes. Learn the art of showing your strengths while still remaining flexible and castable.

Master the self-tape process from start to finish—from choosing readers and scripts to camera angles, lighting, and more. Hear Thomas' advice on dealing with technical glitches, using accidents to your advantage, and always staying in character. Plus, how to edit for impact while preserving authenticity.

With decades of experience and A-list clients, Thomas packs this episode with knowledge to upgrade your headshots, self-tapes, and booking potential. Discover the photographer traits to prioritize, retouching dos and don'ts, and quick fixes when ideal conditions aren't possible.

Whether you're just starting your acting journey or are already working but need refreshed headshots, this episode shares foolproof strategies to get noticed and get hired. Tune in now to craft your standout headshots and unforgettable self-tapes!

This episode is brought to you by Angelica Novak's PIC852 Channel.

Want more insider tips to boost your acting career? Don't miss our upcoming episodes on acing auditions, growing your online presence, and mapping your path to success.

Visit www.pic852photography.co.uk and subscribe so you never miss an episode. We’re available on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, and wherever you enjoy your podcasts.

Follow PIC852 Photography on Instagram @pic852_photography or behind-the-scenes looks at our show and guests.

If you enjoyed this episode, please leave us a review. Your support helps us reach more actors with this essential career advice.

Thanks for listening, and see you soon with a new episode on the PIC852 Channel podcast!

title: Bachata PopiWa Podcast
description:
Step into the enchanting universe of Bachata with PopiWa Podcasts, your premier portal to the vibrant rhythms of a global movement. As we venture into the pulsating heart of this phenomenon, we amplify voices from every corner of the Bachata realm: the maestros crafting hypnotic melodies, the dancers weaving stories through their steps, the visionaries orchestrating iconic festivals and nightclubs, and the strategic minds—whether businessmen or politicians—propelling the Bachata wave worldwide.

Every episode unfolds a rich tapestry, from tracing Bachata's historic roots and evolution to dissecting its timeless melodies. We bring you behind-the-scenes glimpses with festival organizers curating legendary events and club maestros setting unforgettable scenes. Our narratives aren’t just about dance or music—they encapsulate resilience, passion, and the impact Bachata has on global industries and politics.

PopiWa Podcasts is not just a viewing and listening voyage; it's a comprehensive Bachata education and celebration. Through our lens, witness the choreography of dance floors, the symphony of sounds, and the trailblazers shaping this dance revolution. Dive in, and let the multifaceted world of Bachata captivate your senses.

Through this podcast, Miche wants to uncover the wonderful things that are igniting the classical music world and in doing so puts the classical musical world to rights!

title: Ross Meets: The OMG Years
description:
Welcome to "Ross Meets: The OMG Years, a podcast that documents, discovers and celebrates the next generation of music artists, whilst exploring the history of seasoned talents. Each interview included in this podcast, takes listeners on a journey into the lives and music of each musician. Some are more experienced whereas some are brand new to the industry.

Ross has carefully selected a diverse range of musicians spanning various genres, that leapt out to him as soon as he saw/heard them for the first time. There is tons of candid conversation here, documented through the host, Ross Ferguson's time at Staffordshire university's student radio station, OMG Radio. Listeners gain a unique glimpse into the personal and artistic journeys of both the artist on display and Ross himself, who prides himself on natural, fun and insightful interviews to delve into each artists background, inspirations, creative processes, and hopes for the future.
